Subject: Re: New SharpNEAT User
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=132038968; y=0HGA5o_VC5Z1W_6qQpe09QvPlBX3wV_LHEeNH-FhXiqSlzWw

I kicked around a few ideas for a project, many getting wildly out of
hand, and settled on Braille character recognition.  It let me play
with a bit of development while using your OCR experiment as a
framework.  I thought the reduced 7 X 5 input grid and very distinct
character set would be a snap for the network.  Now I know better. 
Thirty-five inputs and twenty-six outputs is too much for a one-to-one
connected net so the problem isn't trivial.  I'm having fun playing
with the various search parameters, especially the frequency of "add
connections" and "add nodes".

The downside of adding an experiment is my SharpNEAT library and some
of the Form1 initialization differ from the standard release.

Lots to play with and I haven't even looked at the network code.

Carl
